intro: Hesperis matronalis subsp. schurii, commonly known as the Schur's honesty, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves and upright flowering stems. Its flowers are white with a distinctive purple or violet hue at the base, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
